Not for me.
What I thought would be a romantic comedy turned out to be a porn flick, and a lousy one. would give it a minus if I could

I remembered this from a movie channel back in the '80s but it doesn't hold up. While Carol Levy is beautiful and fun to watch, the story is plodding, and the sex is played more for (very poor) laughs than sensuality.
Tired story line. Mediocre acting. Not sexy, laughable. I kept waiting for improvement. It never happened. Take it off your watch list.

I am a big fan of Radley Metzger owning several of his finest movies, which was reason enough to buy this feature. Unfortunately this movie doesn't even begin to approach the level of the likes of "Lickerish Quartet", "Camille 2000", "Score" ore the hardcore features he made under the pseudonym Henry Paris. Great pity but even a master some times strikes out.

Oh please. This is a ghastly film. I only bought it because I think the leading man, Victor Bevine, is totally hot and there is a long scene of him without his clothes. The lighting is somewhat dim, and there is nothing full frontal, but he is a fuzzy delicious morsel as ever was. Victor gives beefcake a very good name.

For being a Metzger movie I expected a lot more! In the 70's he was a "pioneer" in erotic cinema, I thought that in the 80's he would go further, WRONG! The story is good and very original, but there is just not enough sex appeal throughout the movie, the few scenes are very "unerotic" and for being the 80's could have definately been more "daring"!
Story is fine, but quality of DVD transfer is weak.
bad
ok

Great flash back to another time. Picture is clear. Sound is great. About  90 minutes long. In color. Story about princess that got to return favor call girl did for her years ago.  It has stood the test of time for me. Saw it originally at drive in. Audrey was the princess. Lucy was the call girl. Came packed well. Nothing damaged.
